body:
Temporarily, as an experiment.

Ruqqus has grown quite a bit, with hundreds of guilds covering a large number of topics, yet, there are still lots of people posting directly to +general.

I believe +general should be a fallback for when a post is removed from a guild, and not allow direct posting to it.

It would be worthwhile to try this for about a week.
body_html:
Temporarily, as an experiment.

Ruqqus has grown quite a bit, with hundreds of guilds covering a large number of topics, yet, there are still lots of people posting directly to +general.

I believe +general should be a fallback for when a post is removed from a guild, and not allow direct posting to it.

It would be worthwhile to try this for about a week.
title: We should temporarily disable posting to +general

body: Good Suggestion. I see many posts that have very specific guilds to post but still oosted in General. It would be a nice experiment.
body_html: Good Suggestion. I see many posts that have very specific guilds to post but still oosted in General. It would be a nice experiment.

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

body:
Seems like an interesting idea. Why not? +general doesn't have a purpose aside from kicking posts to it, and if this experiment doesn't work out, we just revert back to what +general used to be.

 @kek @captainmeta4 @arkitekt
body_html:
Seems like an interesting idea. Why not? +general doesn't have a purpose aside from kicking posts to it, and if this experiment doesn't work out, we just revert back to what +general used to be.

@kek @captainmeta4 @arkitekt

body: I dont use general because I think its dumb to allow posts to be yanked to other guilds but I dont mind having it as a place for posts that get kicked from guilds or that just dont belong.

body: I noticed that if you post in a guild, and try to post again, without clicking the guild symbol, you will post in general.   Try it.  You will see.  You will probably have to fix that.   @captainmeta4

You can still see my posts on archive.org. And check out +uslashremoved!

I'm cqtz- on reddit and cqtz on SaidIt. https://youtube.com/watch?v=o_LskiXQ73c

body:
What if you're banned from the guilds that your post would be relevant to? (IMO, the secondary purpose of +general is so that there's a place where you can post even if you're banned from every single other guild.)

An idea that I like is to have +general be a catch-all guild with no guildmasters and to have a different place for kicked posts to go.

![](https://i.ibb.co/MR5FfzB/sfrohne.png)
body_html:
What if you're banned from the guilds that your post would be relevant to? (IMO, the secondary purpose of +general is so that there's a place where you can post even if you're banned from every single other guild.)

An idea that I like is to have +general be a catch-all guild with no guildmasters and to have a different place for kicked posts to go.

Temporarily, as an experiment.

Ruqqus has grown quite a bit, with hundreds of guilds covering a large number of topics, yet, there are still lots of people posting directly to +general.

I believe +general should be a fallback for when a post is removed from a guild, and not allow direct posting to it.

It would be worthwhile to try this for about a week.
post.title: We should temporarily disable posting to +general

body: If you're banned from every guild, it's probably best to just make a new account. Plus, there may even be an alternative version of the guild. But yeah, that's a good point too.
body_html: If you're banned from every guild, it's probably best to just make a new account. Plus, there may even be an alternative version of the guild. But yeah, that's a good point too.

parent.body:
What if you're banned from the guilds that your post would be relevant to? (IMO, the secondary purpose of +general is so that there's a place where you can post even if you're banned from every single other guild.)

An idea that I like is to have +general be a catch-all guild with no guildmasters and to have a different place for kicked posts to go.

![](https://i.ibb.co/MR5FfzB/sfrohne.png)
parent.body_html:
What if you're banned from the guilds that your post would be relevant to? (IMO, the secondary purpose of +general is so that there's a place where you can post even if you're banned from every single other guild.)

An idea that I like is to have +general be a catch-all guild with no guildmasters and to have a different place for kicked posts to go.

It would be worthwhile to try this for about a week.

body:
> If you're banned from every guild, it's probably best to just make a new account

post.title: We should temporarily disable posting to +general

body:
I don't like this idea. I like the +general sub. I like having a place to share things when I don't know of an appropriate guild. 

Even if there is an appropriate guild, maybe someone does not like the way the guild is run. In that case they can post it to general. If someone has been banned from a guild they have a place to share something without having to create a new guild just for that purpose. This means guildmasters cant silence users.
body_html:
I don't like this idea. I like the +general sub. I like having a place to share things when I don't know of an appropriate guild.

If someone has been banned from a guild they have a place to share something without having to create a new guild just for that purpose. This means guildmasters cant silence users.
